stepTitle: A clothing business finds there is a linear relationship between the number of shirts, $$n$$, it can sell and the price, $$p$$, it can charge per shirt. In particular, historical data shows that 1,000 shirts can be sold at a price of $30, while 3,000 shirts can be sold at a price of $22. Find a linear equation in the form $$p(n)=mn+b$$ that gives the price $$p$$ they can charge for $$n$$ shirts.
